post.Title: Java desktop links of the week, April 15
post.Content:
Hi all, here's your links for another week. Enjoy! :-)

JavaFX

  • Adam Bien has posted a YouTube video on 'Dependency Injection, Inversion of Control and Convention over Configuration ...with JavaFX 8'.
  • Robin Leo Söderström has posted a four-post series covering the development of an app he calls FXComparer, which is an open source application for comparing archives.
  • Robert Ladstätter has two posts this week, both related to image processing in JavaFX. Firstly, he has posted on 'using your webcam with JavaFX and openCV', and secondly he has a post titled 'image processing with OpenCV and JavaFX'.
  • Jim Kay has made available his source code for his JavaFX 3D support (in JavaFX 2.0, not 8.0 - where there is built in support for 3D).
  • Speaking of JavaFX 3D (and this time the JavaFX 8.0 kind), mihosoft have a blog post showing off JavaFX 3D inside their window control.
  • FXForm2-0.21 has been released. FXForm2 is a form generator for JavaFX that generates forms based on the provided bean.
  • Jens Deters has a blog detailing how he uses JavaFX on a Raspberry Pi to control LED lights via the CPIO-out pins.

Swing

  • Geertjan Wielenga has posted a three-part series of posts covering NASA Mission Operations and how they use the NetBeans platform.

Catch you all in a weeks time! :-)
